text: [Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
hello I am Gupta a cloud support
engineer here at AWS office in Hyderabad
India today I am going to show you how
to add AWS identity and access
management identity Center successor to
AWS single sign-on as a Federated
identity provider to an Amazon cognitive
user pool let's get started
Amazon cognitive usables allow Federated
sign in through third-party ID base
including the IM identity Center as a
samlidp first let's set up an IM
identity Center environment on an AWS
account note you can skip this section
if you have a working IM identity Center
environment
sign in to the AWS Management console
and navigate to IM identity center
console
choose the reason that you want and then
choose the enable button
this creates an environment with the
identity Center directory as the
identity source
let's create a user choose the user
section from the left navigation menu
choose the add user button
enter the username and all other
required attributes
when you are done choose next
add the user to a group if you have any
for now we can skip this
choose next
review the details entered and then
choose add user
let's now configure a Amazon cognitive
usable with default settings
navigate to Amazon cognitive user pull
console
select the add user directories to your
app in the drop down list and choose
create user pool
select the Federated identity providers
check box and choose the attributes in
your user pool that are used to sign in
I am choosing email for this
demonstration
next choose saml for the Federated
sign-in options
and then choose next
let's keep the default password policy
select the type of MFM method if you
want to have MFA authentication for your
Amazon Cognito native uses this is not
applicable for Federated users I am
choosing no MFA for nav let's keep the
default section for user account
recovery
choose next choose the settings for cell
service sign up and attribute
verification and account confirmation
that you need I am using the default
settings
select the required attributes that you
want to have on your usable email is
automatically selected for me based on
my previous selection of the
configuration
choose next
for email settings let's choose send
email with Amazon Cognito for nav
choose next
we will skip this section for now and
configure this after creating the saml
application in the IM identity Center so
select skip for nav and choose next
enter a name for your user pool
enter a domain name enter domain names
are dynamically checked for availability
make sure that the domain name you
entered is available
provide a name for your app client
enter your applications URL in the
allowed callback URL section this is the
URL of the page where your user is
redirected to after a successful
Authentication
for testing purpose I'll use my
localhost
expand Advanced app client settings
for oauth 2.0 Grant types choose only
implicit band for now
let's leave the default settings for
reminding choose next
review all the settings and note the
Amazon Cognito domain
choose create user pool
when it's finished copy the user pool ID
we'll use them when we configure the
saml application in IM identity Center
now let's create a saml 2.0 application
in the IM identity Center
navigate to IM identity center console
under the application assignment section
choose applications
choose add application
and then choose add custom saml 2.0
application
choose next
change the display name to Amazon
cognitive application
and provide a description for example
application for Amazon cognitive usable
copy the URL of the IM identity Center's
saml metadata file or choose the
download hyperlink we'll need them when
configuring the saml identity provider
in the Amazon cognitive user pool for
now I am copying the link
now under the application metadata
section choose manually type your
metadata values
for the application SES URL paste the
Amazon cognitive domain and append it
with Slash saml 2 IDP response
for application saml audience provide
choose submit
under the actions drop down list choose
edit attribute mappings
and provide the values as
the format as persistent
choose add new attribute mapping and
provide the user attribute in the
section as email and in the maps to the
string value or user attribute in IM
identity Center
this
and the format as basic choose save
changes
nav choose assign users
and then select the user that we created
previously
choose assign users
now let's configure IIM identity Center
as a saml identity provider in the
Amazon cognitive user pool navigate to
Amazon cognitive usable console
and then choose your user pool
inside the sign in experience section
choose add identity provider in
Federated identity provider sign in
choose saml
and enter a provider name
now choose enter metadata document
endpoint URL in the metadata document
source
paste the URL that you copied earlier
while creating the saml 2.0 application
in the IM identity Center
in the saml attribute provide the email
choose add identity providers
now you must add this identity provider
to our user Pool app client
to do this navigate to app integration
section
open your app client from the app
clients list
in the hosted UI section choose edit
now choose the selected identity
providers drop down list
select the IM identity Center provider
that we created in the previous section
scroll to the bottom and choose save
changes
now let's test the setup from the hosted
UI
within the host address section of your
app client choose view hosted UI button
now you see the Amazon cognitos hosted
UI page choose the IM identity Center
provider
we are now redirected to the IM identity
Center login page
enter the credentials of the user that
we created earlier
after the successful authentication you
are redirected to the Callback URL and
the JW tokens issued by Amazon Cognito
are visible in the URL with this you
have successfully configured IM identity
Center as identity provider of your user
pool
and now you know how to add IM identity
Center as a Federated identity provider
to a Amazon cognitive user pool
thanks for watching and happy cloud
computing from all of us here in AWS
[Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
thank you
[Music]
